messages.subject: Re: I need help with Bakugan
messages.msgSnippet: I m right there with you! This is my 12 year old s newest passion, so I am brawling every day because he hasn t found any other kids in the neighborhood to
messages.messageBody:
I'm right there with you! This is my 12 year old's newest passion, so I am "brawling" every day because he hasn't found any other kids in the neighborhood to brawl with, lol! Every time I get the hang of something, he finds a new passion, I was getting really good at yugioh, lol!
Blessings,
Wendy

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] I need help with Bakugan
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you!!! Tammy Curry, Director of Chaos http://tammycurry.blogspot.com/ http://crazy-homeschool-adventures.blogspot.com/ If a child is to keep alive his
messages.messageBody:
Thank you!!!


Tammy Curry, Director of Chaos
http://tammycurry.blogspot.com/
http://crazy-homeschool-adventures.blogspot.com/

"If a child is to keep alive his inborn sense of wonder, he needs the companionship of at least one adult who can share it, rediscovering with him the joy, excitement and mystery of the world we live in."

Rachel Carson





________________________________
From: Betj <bkind28@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, April 16, 2009 8:18:41 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] I need help with Bakugan





My 13 year old Jay plays and said he'd help. You can email him at soccermaster12@ rocketmail. com. He also said there is a little rule book that come with a pack of Bakugan and a TV show on Cartoon Network.
Sent from my Verizon Wireless BlackBerry

-----Original Message-----
From: Tammy Curry <mamabeart00@ yahoo.com>

Date: Thu, 16 Apr 2009 17:09:20
To: <unschoolingbasics@ yahoogroups. com>
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] I need help with Bakugan


The only place I could think to turn to for help with my 4 yr old's current passion. I am trying to learn how to play Bakugan and who are all the different battle brawlers are. Is there anyone else who has a Bakugan fan in their midst that might be able to point me in the right direction? I have seen my son get excited over super heroes, Ben10, and several others but Bakugan seems to be the ultimate with him right now and he is more excited about this than anything else he has been in the past.


Tammy Curry, Director of Chaos
http://tammycurry. blogspot. com/
http://crazy- homeschool- adventures. blogspot. com/

"If a child is to keep alive his inborn sense of wonder, he needs the companionship of at least one adult who can share it, rediscovering with him the joy, excitement and mystery of the world we live in."

Rachel Carson
